communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Flock Installs (Fontana Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records related to the installation, approval, and locations of automatic license plate readers from Motorola and Flock Safety

Emails from: 
Akeia Dixon - installs@flocksafety.com
Dave@flocksafety.com
garrett@flocksafety.com
Motorola email domain names

Do not include promo emails or emails from hello@flocksafety.com

Communications related to installations. 
Keyword search: 
"installations"
"install" 
"technicians"
"public works"
"rebates"

Copies of attachments. 
Copies of documentation of installations that include their locations, approvals by the city for installations, and contracts related to the installations 

Limit search to: 2018 - 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Video Footage, Hamline Elementary
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Video camera footage of all exterior cameras at Hamline Elementary school from 10am through 2:15pm on January 24, 2025. I am not looking for any student specific information; CPS can redact/blur any student faces that appear on video footage in this time frame. 

This request is on behalf of The FOIA Bakery, an Illinois nonprofit. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=16806

communications.subject: University of Nevada, Reno - Public Records Request PRR-1874-28: Completed
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,

The request Request Number: PRR-1874-28 has been completed. Please click on the request link to download the responsive documents that have been made available to you.

The University produces the document responsive to PRR 1874-28.  Disciplinary complaints and investigations as well as Title IX and discrimination complaints and investigations of complaints involving employees, if any, are confidential personnel matters and are protected from public disclosure under the Board of Regents Handbook, the NSHE Code (including section 5.6.2) and the common law balancing test.  Donrey v. Bradshaw, 106 Nev. 630, 636, 798 P.2d 144 (1990). The NSHE Code has the force and effect of statute.  State ex rel. Richardson v. Board of Regents, 70 Nev. 144, 150 (1953).  To the extent such complaints and investigations, if any, involve students, they are confidential under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (“FERPA”), which deems education records of students to be confidential.  See 20 U.S.C. section 1232g(4) and 34 C.F.R. section 99.3 and NSHE BOR Handbook, Title 4, Chapter 1, Section 28.  Such records are also confidential under the common law balancing test.  Donrey v. Bradshaw, 106 Nev. 630, 636, 798 P.2d 144 (1990).  Pursuant to Nev. Rev. Stat. (NRS) 239.010, confidential or privileged records are exempt from public disclosure. UNR relies, in good faith, on this claim of confidentiality and therefore such records, if any, are not subject to production.  NRS 239.0107(d)(2); NRS 239.012.  
  
 Thank you, 
   
 University of Nevada, Reno 
 1664 N. Virginia Street, MS 0208
Reno, NV 89557

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 
All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 
Sincerely, 
Rose Terse Douglas County WA has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the Public Records Request Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records. County Records Request - C002145-020525 If you have any questions, believe the County’s response is incomplete, or if I have misunderstood your request, please contact me immediately. Our office believes we have provided all records responsive to your request for public records dated 2/1/2025, and now considers your request fulfilled and closed.  Because this office does not intend to further address your request, we are notifying you that the Public Record Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review pursuant to RCW 42.56.550(6) is now in effect. Sincerely, Tiana Rowland 
Administration

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Responses to RFI# FWBP-CC-24-183, Request for Information for Child Care Assistance Case Management and Payment Systems, Iowa Department of Health and Human Services
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Find responses to RFI# FWBP-CC-24-183, Request for Information for Child Care Assistance Case Management and Payment Systems, Iowa Department of Health and Human Services. Proposals were due on 4/23/2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Re: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Responses to RFI# FWBP-CC-24-183, Request for Information for Child Care Assistance Case Management and Payment Systems, Iowa Department of Health and Human Services
communications.communication:
Hello Toni,

The Iowa Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has received your open records request and will be back in contact soon.  You may view the Department's open records policy at Open Records Policy<https://hhs.iowa.gov/initiatives/open-records>.

Iowa HHS attempts to determine if we have responsive records that can be released within 10 business days, but it may take longer based on the complexity of your request or workload and staffing issues.  I'll do my best to keep you updated if we will require additional time on this request.

Please let me know if you have any questions at this time.  Thank you for your request.


HHS Open Records

Division of Compliance

Iowa Department of Health and Human Services

321 E 12th St., Des Moines, IA 50319

Hhsopenrecords@hhs.iowa.gov

HHS.Iowa.gov<http://hhs.iowa.gov/>

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: P096005-112524
communications.communication:
Dear Rebecca Burns: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Houston Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 11/25/2024 and given the reference number P096005-112524 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of complaints submitted to the Boarding Homes Investigation Unit since 2018 concerning potential non-permitted boarding homes, sufficient to show:
-The total number of complaints
-The addresses of properties subject to complaints
-Any enforcement action taken pursuant to the complaints

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpolice-department-336%252Fhouston-boarding-home-complaints-176880%252F%253Femail%253Dhpd.openrecords%252540houstonpolice.org&url_auth_token=AAAVVJD0KxlBQ1N60poO756rUa8%3A1tFmhx%3Als0l7olJu8SUpCIwYe4rSM8piZhXd4v5NRhVVbmWscg 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant Houston Police Department department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Houston Public Information Request Center. 
Houston Police Department

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of November 25, 2024, Reference # P096005-112524 Dear Rebecca Burns, The Houston Police Department has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the Houston Public Information Request Center at the following link to retrieve the appropriate responsive documents. 
We will release the documents within 24 to 48 hours after the payment is received. If it is a weekend or holiday, then we will release the documents the next business working day. Please note regarding the “total number of complaints”, we have no way of knowing how many complaints the City has received since 2018. That information may be available through the City’s 311 system. Also, regarding enforcement action, the Boarding Home Investigations Unit has issued approximately 2169 citations to unpermitted boarding homes since January of 2018. 
Sincerely, Jasmine Stewart Administrative Specialist Houston Police Department (HPD)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (February 2025) (Franklin County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R006254-020325
communications.communication:
Franklin County Public Records Request 

RE: 5 DAY RESPONSE PURSUANT TO RCW 42.56.520 

REQUEST NO. R006254-020325 

Dear  Rose Terse, 

Franklin County is in receipt of your Public Records Request dated 2/3/2025 and received on 02/01/2025 for "Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 
All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.". 
Your request has been assigned Public Records Request Number R006254-020325. Please refer to this number in any future correspondence regarding this request. 

We are in the process of gathering, identifying, and reviewing records responsive to your request but we need additional time to respond the high volume of records requested. 

We estimate we will be able to provide you with the records or a first installment on or around 02/19/25. 

Thank you for contacting Franklin County. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact my office at 509-546-5854 or recordsoffice@franklincountywa.gov. 
Sincerely, 

Lizette Parra

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R006254-020325
communications.communication:
Franklin County Public Records Request 

RE: REQUEST NO. R006254-020325 IS NOW CLOSED 

Dear  Rose Terse, 

The Franklin County Public Records Office has processed your public records request, received on 02/01/2025. 

The records that are responsive to your request for, “Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 
All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.,” are being provided to you, today, 02/06/2025, via GovQA Portal. 

As your records have been delivered, your request, R006254-020325, is now considered closed. If you are dissatisfied with our response, pursuant to RCW 42.56.550(6), you may file an appeal to the Franklin County Prosecutor’s Office, Civil Division. You have one year from today’s date, 02/06/2025, to file. You may contact the Prosecutor’s Office at 509-545-3543 with any questions or concerns you have at this time. 
Sincerely, 

Lizette Parra

communications.subject: FOIA Request 2019-01586
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Neiss


This is in response to  your 27 January 2020, Freedom of Information Act request documents relating to "I request an electronic copy of the logo for the United States Space Force tweeted out this afternoon by the President in SVG or EPS file format.

We contacted the USSF for responsive records and were notified the records you are seeking are publicly available by accessing https://www.spaceforce.mil/About-Us/About-Space-Force/USSF-Symbols/, and https://www.spaceforce.mil/News/Article/2282948/the-us-space-force-logo-and-motto/

Please direct your questions to Janet Beasley at (703) 614-3025 or janet.beasley@us.af.mil<mailto:janet.beasley@us.af.mil> and reference case number 2019-01586-F.


V/r

//SIGNED//
JANET F. BEASLEY, DAF GS-12
Government Information Specialist/Paralegal
Headquarters Air Force Information Office (SAF/AAII)
DSN: 224-3025
Commercial: 703-614-3025
I have migrated to CHES. My new email address is Janet.beasley@us.af.mil<mailto:Janet.beasley@us.af.mil>
Workflow:  SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.workflow@us.af.mil<mailto:SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.workflow@us.af.mil>.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2020-01586-F
communications.communication:
The documents released are not responsive to my request. I asked for the Space Force logo in its original SVG or EPS file format. 

A modified version of the original government document can be found at the link provided below with the note "The U.S. Space Force seal is reserved for internal, official use only and marked here to discourage unauthorized use. ": https://www.spaceforce.mil/About-Us/About-Space-Force/USSF-Symbols/

I am asking for that original logo itself in the format in which it was initially created by or for the government, which again, will likely be SVG or EPS.

files.title: RESPONSE FOIA Request 2019-01586
files.source: Air Force, United States of America

title: Data on school-based arrests (Marlborough Police Department)

communications.communication:
To whoever it may concern:  
  

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. 

Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.  

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

  

I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):  

  

1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:  

a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement  

b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement  

c. Charge (or charges)  

d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement  

e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement  

j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school. 

k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and  

l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.  

  

2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  

  

3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  

  

4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.  

  

5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).   

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”  

  

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.  

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).  

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety. 

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.  

  

Sincerely,  

Katherine Stathulis

J.D. Research Fellow

Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration 

Northeastern University School of Law

k.stathulis@northeastern.edu
  
617-373-5862

In response to your public records request, on behalf of the records access officer(s) and records custodians of the Police Department, I am writing to inform you that the responsive records from the Marlborough Public School District are attached. communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Nassau County PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Nassau County Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Nassau County PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on March 22, 2024. The request was for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Nassau County Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.subject: FW: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Nassau County PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Nassau County Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."

Please find links to 2 PDF documents below that are responsive to your request. Please note that pursuant to Sections 87(2)(b) and 87(2)(e)(iv) of the Public Officers Law (POL), certain portions have been redacted for personal privacy and to not reveal criminal investigative techniques or procedures.

Pursuant to POL §89(4)(a), you may appeal this determination within 30 days to the Counsel, Division of Criminal Justice Services, 80 South Swan St., Albany, NY 12210 or by email at foil@dcjs.ny.gov<mailto:foil@dcjs.ny.gov>.

Very truly yours,

Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer







New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services
FOIL Office
80 South Swan Street
Albany, NY 12210

March 22, 2024

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Nassau County Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Settlements (Kern County Counsel)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all reports, lists, databases, or individual documents created since 1/1/16 detail lawsuits brought against the city's police department. This should include any documentation mechanism your department uses to track lawsuits. It should also include any documents your department submits to local, state, or federal agencies listing the number and/or status of lawsuits brought against the police department.

This request should be construed to include documents compiled quarterly, annually, or in other increments as well as documents or databases that contain responsive information over a longer time span.

Please provide all available materials from January 1, 2016 through November 6, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: CPRA request
communications.communication:
Hello, I'm in receipt of a request to Kern County for "police records."  I'd like to clarify with you:  we don't represent the Bakersfield Police Department, that CPRA would be directed to the City of Bakersfield.  Did you mean this to be directed to the Kern County Sheriff's office for sheriff records?
Please let me know, thank you--





Kathleen Rivera, Chief Deputy County Counsel
1115 Truxtun Avenue, Fourth Floor
Bakersfield, CA 93301
Direct Line: (661) 868-3820<tel:6618683820>
krivera@<mailto:krivera@co.kern.ca.us>kerncounty.com

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Police Settlements (Kern County Counsel)
communications.communication:
Yes, the Kern County Sheriffs. 

Thank you,
Joey

communications.subject: Re: California Public Records Act Request: Police Settlements (Kern County Counsel)
communications.communication:
Thank you for that clarification.

This e mail is in response to your CPRA, regarding sheriff records, sent electronically on 11/6/24 to our County Counsel at mraison@kerncounty.com.  This request asked for police records.  I e mailed you on 11/18 asking if you meant to request sheriff records, as we do not represent the police department.  You responded on 11/19 that yes, you meant sheriff records.

The County is unable to fully respond to your request within the 10-day statutory time period. Due to the following “unusual circumstances,” the County will need additional time as provided by California Government Code section 7922.535:
(1) The need to search for and collect the requested records from field facilities or other establishments that are separate from the office processing the request.
(2) The need to search for, collect, and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records that are demanded in a single request.
(3) The need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, among two or more components of the agency having substantial subject matter interest therein.
I will respond to your requests further by December5 , 2024.
If you have any questions regarding the County’s response to your requests, you may contact me at (661) 868-3820, or  email at krivera@kerncounty.com.
Respectfully,


Kathleen Rivera, Chief Deputy County Counsel
1115 Truxtun Avenue, Fourth Floor
Bakersfield, CA 93301
Direct Line: (661) 868-3820<tel:6618683820>
krivera@<mailto:krivera@co.kern.ca.us>kerncounty.com

communications.subject: CPRA request
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scott:
This letter is in response to your request for public records, dated November 7, 2024, and delivered to the County of Kern (“County”) via electronic mail.   This is an update to my previous letter to you.  County staff have consulted in relation to your request and have begun to search for the requested records. The County will need additional time as provided by California Government Code section 7922.535 due to the following “unusual circumstances:”
the need to search for and collect the requested records from field facilities or other establishments that are separate from the office processing the request; and the need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, among two or more components of the agency having substantial subject matter interest therein.
The County will respond to your requests further by January 6, 2025.If you have any questions regarding the County’s response to your requests, you may contact me at (661) 868-3820, or by email at krivera@kerncounty.com<mailto:krivera@kerncounty.com>. Please note the County is closed for winter recess Dec. 24th-Jan. 1st.

Kathleen Rivera, Chief Deputy County Counsel
1115 Truxtun Avenue, Fourth Floor
Bakersfield, CA 93301
Direct Line: (661) 868-3820<tel:6618683820>
krivera@<mailto:krivera@co.kern.ca.us>kerncounty.com

Dear Mr. Mellins: 
This email is in response to the above-referenced FOIL request. 
Please be advised that Public Officers Law § 89(3)(a) provides that a request for records shall reasonably describe the records sought.  Your request does not reasonably describe records and requires the following clarification(s): 
Please clarify whether “currently uncollected monies,” as referenced in your request, includes items with future pay dates.

communications.subject: [NYS OAG FOIL Request Center] General FOIL Request :: G000474-071823
communications.communication:
July 26, 2024 RE:  Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request Reference # G000474-071823 Dear Mr. Mellins: This email is in response to the above-­referenced FOIL request. The Office of the Attorney General has conducted a diligent search for the records that you have requested. Please access this request in the NYS OAG FOIL Request Center to retrieve records that respond to your request.  Please be advised that portions of the records that respond to your request are exempt from disclosure and have been redacted pursuant to: • Public Officers Law § 87(2)(a), which provides that records that are exempted from disclosure by state or federal statute are exempt from disclosure under FOIL.  The records constitute protected health information, which is exempt from disclosure under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (“HIPAA”) and New York State Public Health Law § 18; and • Public Officers Law § 87(2)(b), because their disclosure would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. You have a right to appeal the foregoing decision.  If you elect to do so, you must appeal in writing, within 30 days, to Kathryn Sheingold, Records Appeals Officer.  Your appeal can be sent by email to or by mail to State of New York, Office of the Attorney General, Division of Appeals and Opinions, The Capitol, Albany, New York 12224.  You can reach the Records Appeals Officer by telephone at (518) 776-2009. (mailto:FOIL.Appeals@ag.ny.gov) FOIL.Appeals@ag.ny.gov This is our third and final response to the above-referenced request. Accordingly, this FOIL request is now closed. Sincerely, Abisola Fatade Assistant Attorney General 
 
Please visit the NYS OAG FOIL Request Center to view frequently asked questions, monitor request progress, and submit future requests. 
 View this request in the My Request Center.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #G000474-071823
communications.communication:
Hello Abisola,

Thanks so much for sending this trove along -- I really appreciate it. I wanted to ask if something could be added to these documents: the date each judgment was entered. It would be helpful to get a sense of which are older and which newer. 

Thanks! 
Sam Mellins
Senior Reporter, New York Focus

communications.subject: [NYS OAG FOIL Request Center] General FOIL Request :: G000474-071823
communications.communication:
August 7, 2024 RE:  Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request Reference # G000474-071823 Dear Mr. Mellins: Pursuant to Public Officers Law §89(3)(a), the Office of the Attorney General acknowledges receipt of your amendment to the above-referenced FOIL request. We are performing a diligent search for the records you request.  We will notify you of the status of your request on or before August 23, 2024. If we should locate any documents that respond to your request, and if we provide them in electronic format, we will notify you of any fee in advance.  If we provide paper copies, we will also notify you of any fee in advance; for paper copies, the first five pages would be provided free of charge, and the cost for the remaining pages would be $.25 per page. Sincerely, Abisola Fatade Assistant Attorney General 
 
Please visit the NYS OAG FOIL Request Center to view frequently asked questions, monitor request progress, and submit future requests.

communications.subject: [NYS OAG FOIL Request Center] General FOIL Request :: G000474-071823
communications.communication:
August 23, 2024 
RE: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request Reference # G000474-071823 
Dear Mr. Mellins: 
Please be advised that we are diligently engaged in the process of completing our response to the above-referenced FOIL request. We estimate that, by October 9, 2024, we will be able to begin producing to you the records that respond to your request addendum. This additional time is needed for the following reasons: 
• the volume of records that must be reviewed in order to respond to your request; and 
• the detailed nature of the review required to respond to your request. 
We will contact you on or before the date mentioned. 

Thank you for your cooperation in this matter. Sincerely, Abisola Fatade Assistant Attorney General

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #G000474-071823
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following New York Freedom of Information Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 18, 2023. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Oct. 9, 2024. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #G000474-071823.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: [NYS OAG FOIL Request Center] General FOIL Request :: G000474-071823
communications.communication: February 5, 2025 RE:  Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request Reference # G000474-071823 Dear Mr. Mellins: This email is in response to the above-­referenced FOIL request. The Office of the Attorney General has conducted a diligent search for the records that you have requested. Please access this request in the NYS OAG FOIL Request Center to retrieve records that respond to your request.  Please be advised that portions of the records are exempt from disclosure and have been redacted pursuant to: • Public Officers Law § 87(2)(a), which provides that records that are exempted from disclosure by state or federal statute are exempt from disclosure under FOIL.  The records constitute protected health information, which is exempt from disclosure under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (“HIPAA”) and New York State Public Health Law § 18; and • Public Officers Law § 87(2)(b), because their disclosure would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. You have a right to appeal the foregoing decision.  If you elect to do so, you must appeal in writing, within 30 days, to Kathryn Sheingold, Records Appeals Officer.  Your appeal can be sent by email to FOIL.Appeals@ag.ny.gov or by mail to State of New York, Office of the Attorney General, Division of Appeals and Opinions, The Capitol, Albany, New York 12224.  You can reach the Records Appeals Officer by telephone at (518) 776-2009. This is our fourth and final response to the above-referenced request. Accordingly, this FOIL request is now closed. Sincerely, Records Access Officer

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (February 2025) (Island County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request: Fusus logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1) User manuals, handbooks, or comparable instructional documents provided to the department by Fusus regarding the following Fusus products and services:
- FususONE (https://www.fusus.com/rtc3-products/fususone)
- FususCORE (https://www.fusus.com/rtc3-products/fususcore)
- FususREGISTRY (https://www.fusus.com/rtc3-products/fususregistry)
- Fusus AI Video Analytics (https://www.fusus.com/rtc3-products/fusus-ai)
- Fusus Intelligent AI Alerts (https://www.fusus.com/rtc3-products/fusus-ai)

2) Audit logs/audit trails documenting each time a department account has accessed live or recorded video footage through the Fusus platforms from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed.

3) Metadata for each Intelligent AI Alert generated by the department's Fusus system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. Fusus Intelligent AI Alerts automatically notify authorized users when Fusus AI-connected cameras detect pre-defined events (e.g. a fight) or profiles (e.g. a vehicle of interest). Please note that I am not requesting the video footage or any personally identifying information associated with the alert, but rather the metadata. Metadata may include, but is not limited to: the type of alert, the date and time of the alert, who received the alert, locations associated with the alert, and algorithmic confidence scores associated with the alert. This metadata should be stored in a database and so I ask that you provide it to me as a .csv, .xls, or other database filetype.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: [Document Released to Requester] Village of Arlington Heights, IL public records request #24-1824
communications.communication:
Village of Arlington Heights, IL ************************************************************************ Documents have been released for record request #24-1824 along with the following message: Your FOIA request for records has been granted in part / denied in part. The exemptions: 1)User manuals, handbooks, or comparable instructional documents provided to the department by Fusus regarding the following Fusus products and services Denied5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a): Under FOIA, information that is protected from disclosure by state or federal law cannot be disclosed pursuant to FOIA. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). Copyright material is protected under Section 106 of the Copyright Act (17 U.S.C. § 106) and, therefore, cannot be disclosed without authorization 2) Audit logs/audit trails documenting each time a department account has accessed live or recorded video footage through the Fusus platforms from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. All months, except February will be made available. There is an open ticket with the vendor to troubleshoot why February data won’t query. I was able to remove empty columns to have data print on one page. I also removed license plates under and IP addresses as 7 1(b), private information and 140/7(1)(d)(v) (v) disclose unique or specialized investigative techniques other than those generally used and known or disclose internal documents of correctional agencies related to detection, observation, or investigation of incidents of crime or misconduct, and disclosure would result in demonstrable harm to the agency or public body that is the recipient of the request; 3) Metadata for each Intelligent AI Alert generated by the department's Fusus system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. Fusus Intelligent AI Alerts automatically notify authorized users when Fusus AI-connected cameras detect pre-defined events (e.g. a fight) or profiles (e.g. a vehicle of interest). Please note that I am not requesting the video footage or any personally identifying information associated with the alert, but rather the metadata. Metadata may include, but is not limited to: the type of alert, the date and time of the alert, who received the alert, locations associated with the alert, and algorithmic confidence scores associated with the alert. This metadata should be stored in a database and so I ask that you provide it to me as a .csv, .xls, or other database filetype. Item number 3 will be denied applying the following exemptions: 140/7(1)(d)(v) (v) disclose unique or specialized investigative techniques other than those generally used and known or disclose internal documents of correctional agencies related to detection, observation, or investigation of incidents of crime or misconduct, and disclosure would result in demonstrable harm to the agency or public body that is the recipient of the request; (vi) endanger the life or physical safety of law enforcement personnel or any other person; (vii) obstruct an ongoing criminal investigation by the agency that is the recipient of the request. (d-7) Information gathered, or records created from the use of automatic license plate readers in connection with Section 2-130 of the Illinois Vehicle Code. I will email this to your email. I didn't receive a password to add to Muckrock. Responsible Official. Maureen Schmidt, a FOIA Officer for the Village, is the official responsible for this denial. Notice of Right to Review by Illinois Attorney General. You have the right to file a request for review of your request and this Notice of Denial by the Public Access Counselor of the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. The Public Access Counselor may be contacted at 500 South 2nd Street, Springfield, Illinois 62701, or by telephone at (877) 299-3642. Notice of Right to Judicial Review. Under Section 11 of the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/11, you have the right to seek judicial review of this denial. The Village cannot advise or represent you in this matter. You should consult your own legal counsel. * JanFususAuditRpt.pdf * MarchFususAuditRpt.pdf * AprilFususAuditRpt.pdf * MayFususAuditRpt.pdf * JuneFususAuditRpt.pdf * JulyFususAuditRpt.pdf * AugFususAuditRpt.pdf * SeptFususAuditRpt.pdf * OctFususAudit.pdf Document links are valid for one month. After December 4, you will need to sign in to view the document(s). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Village of Arlington Heights, IL.
Technical support: See our help page

Notice of Right to Judicial Review. Under Section 11 of the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/11, you have the right to seek judicial review of this denial. The Village cannot advise or represent you in this matter. You should consult your own legal counsel. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Village of Arlington Heights, IL.
Technical support: See our help page

Additional information is required to fulfill your open records request. Please provide the following: 
1. Date range: Please provide a specific date range for this search (e.g. "March 1, 2023 - March 31, 2023" or "September 4, 2020") 
2. Name or email address of sender/receiver: We only have access to Fulton County employees’ email boxes. We cannot search the emails of non-employees unless they previously sent a email to or received an email from a Fulton County employee. Please narrow your request and provide the specific names or emails of the Fulton County employees you are referencing in your request. Please also provide the email address of anyone that is not a Fulton County employee. 
3. Keyword search terms that you would like captured in your search: We cannot fulfill your request without keyword search terms. Please be very specific, otherwise we will have to guess as to what you are asking for and you may not receive all of the emails you are seeking. (e.g. "court" or "police station") 
Once we have received the information requested above, we will forward your request to our IT department so that they may conduct the search. 
Your request will be paused for 10 days while clarification is pending. If we do not receive a response within that time frame, your request will be withdrawn. Once we receive the required information, we will forward your request to the IT department so that they can run the search.*****

There are a total of 2924 emails to review. The cost for this request will be $964.07. This cost represents 48 hours of review and redaction at a rate of $20.19/hour. The first 15 minutes of service has been waived. 
The following information may be exempt/redacted: 

Social security numbers, mother’s birth name, credit card, debit card, bank account, account or utility account passwords and numbers, financial data, insurance and medical records, unlisted telephone numbers, personal e-mail address or cellular telephone number, day and month of birth, and information regarding public utility, television, internet, or telephone accounts held by private customers, O.C.G.A. 50-18-72(a)(20)); 

Records that reveal a public employee’s home address, home telephone number, day and month of birth, social security number, insurance or medical information, mother’s birth name, credit card information, debit card information, bank account information, account number, utility account number, password used to access accounts, financial data or information other than compensation by a government agency, unlisted telephone number, and identity of the public employee’s immediate family members or dependents, O.C.G.A. 50-18-72 (a)(21); 

Communications subject to attorney-client privilege, O.C.G.A. 50-18-72 (a)(41);and 

Confidential attorney work product, O.C.G.A. 50-18-72 (a)(42)

Thank you.

May I amend my request to the following?

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata of all email communications where Patrick Labat is either the sender, recipient, CC'ed, or BCC'ed, sent between the dates of 1/1/2022 and 10/23/2023 and containing at least one of the following keywords: "Talitrix", "electronic monitoring" or "contract." Please include any variations that are not case sensitive. 

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

title: Agency Roster (Glendale City Clerk for PD)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Glendale City Clerk for PD)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Furniture purchases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records and communications about purchases of furniture for the Charlotte and William Bloomberg Medford Public Library, including communications with vendors.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jim Kang

communications.subject: Public Records Request PD-57-2025 Completed
communications.communication:
Good afternoon, 
  
 Some Information has been redacted pursuant to Government Code §7922.000.   
  
 An agency shall justify withholding any record by demonstrating that the record in question is exempt under express provisions of this division, or that on the facts of the particular case the public interest served by not disclosing the record clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure of the record. 
  
 Within the documents, City staff members have redacted personal information, such as personal email addresses, personal phone numbers, insurance policy numbers, Vehicle Identification Numbers (VIN) and familial vehicle insurance information. Public disclosure of the redacted personal information would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. Based on the reasons for the redactions, the public interest served by withholding the redacted information clearly outweighs any public interest served by disclosure (Gov. Code § 7922.000). 
  
   
  
 We have completed your request. If you requested paper copies to be picked up, you may visit us during business hours to retrieve; if you asked for your copies to be mailed, they will be sent on the next business day; if you requested electronic copies, they can be retrieved from the public portal linked below.

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Custom Plate Banned Words (Virginia Department of Motor Vehicles)
communications.communication:
Tom Nash with Jordan,

The Virginia Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) received your request for
information on March 28, 2022, pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of
Information Act (FOIA).  Specifically, you seek:

1.       Procedures on handling Banned words ,symbols or ideals for custom
motor vehicle license plates

2.       a list of banned words or combination of the effect or symbols
which is disallowed for use

In response to request number 1, after a review of DMV’s records, attached
you will find the New Revised Personalized Plate Issuance Guidelines.

In response to request number 2, DMV has provided a list of rejected
personalized plates for 2019, 2020, and 2021 through mid-October. As part
of an update to procedures, DMV stop maintaining this list in October 2021.
If you wish to seek any additional years, the raw data needed to provide
the plates, is contained in DMV’s computer database.  DMV is able to
compile data and run reports to create a record providing the information
you seek in this request.  To do so would require the expenditure of
resources, for which DMV would charge a fee to recover its actual costs
based on an hourly rate for the responding employee’s time plus any
programming, data and duplication costs.  DMV will provide you a cost
estimate to produce a report containing this information. If you would like
to proceed with an ad hoc request to obtain the information you seek,
please complete the attached form and contact Tara Pyatt, Use Agreement
Program and Compliance Manager, via email at tara.pyatt@dmv.virginia.gov.
She will be able to assist you with that process.

Thank you,

DMV FOIA Office

The information contained in the email message and any attachments may be privileged and/or confidential. It is intended only for the use of the individual or entity named in the document. Payment Card Industry Compliance Statement

In efforts to comply with Payment Card Industry (PCI) Compliance regulations and security guidelines, DMV no longer accepts credit payments via email or U.S. Postal Service, effective on April 1, 2015. communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current annual salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Police Public Records Request :: P062938-121624
communications.communication:
Dear Marcus Boyd: 
Thank you for your public records request. Your request has been received by City of Worcester and is being processed in accordance with the Massachusetts Public Records Law. Your request was created on 12/16/2024 and given the reference number P062938-121624 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current annual salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd 
Your request will be processed by the Police Department to locate the document(s) you seek. If there are any necessary costs associated with your request, you will be contacted with a cost breakdown; payment is required prior to commencing the work required to fulfill your request. Please note that the duty to comply with requests for records extends to those records that exist and are in the possession, custody, or control of the custodian of records at the time of the request. See M.G.L. c. 66, section 10(a)(ii). In addition, 32 Op. Att’y Gen 157, 165 (May 18, 1977) held that a custodian is not obligated to create a record in response to a request for information. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Worcester 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXfCXkUr6Lj8iVeNh5Gd3CmQ7TQL3ohixDTYIIlZXvqxjuCJZcOdN4XTZUPWE-2BGqP3ajQl2DCn6dSfUrh3RdUzSg-3DCFhp_CAo1FEG5kcRxZXeg7CjhUYjzGJ36Yt6-2BTIP1w2Qb8ZZJLhIt9BmjeYBrhWWGPovSLvJ6l3SxT3iFgywJ2M3HKdO0VUg8RO5RFpKB3ZP0f5Fj-2FiZhc-2FNuhrSWHV9lbyHLsQ6MCGOsNCTn-2Bcb0wgLaY5dSaleYAofSrdba-2FSe8LUKNUfg1FEH5IuyNM6N2PfaA1nXTAHWUcfyy1nH5BWyufGK-2By2U3pwBpKwIsgPuoD48-3D)

See M.G.L. c. 66, section 10(a)(ii). In addition, 32 Op. Att’y Gen 157, 165 (May 18, 1977) held that a custodian is not obligated to create a record in response to a request for information. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Worcester

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: MPIA Request for IAD Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I am hereby requesting access to the records listed below and held by the Worcester County Sheriff:

- Copies of any and all internal affairs complaints, including internal, citizen, or other agency complaints for former Deputy Sheriff Gregory Wetzel (0194).
- Complete investigative files for each complaint, including but not limited to reports of recorded statements, video surveillance or body camera footage, investigative files, witness interviews, and photographs.
- The investigative findings of each complaint.
- Any correspondence from the Civilian Review Board, Police Advisory Commission or other civilian police oversight board.
- The final disposition of each case, if any.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Alternatively, please consider waiving any fees, pursuant to § 4-206(e)(2)(ii) of the General Provisions Article, as this request is on behalf of individuals served by the Maryland Office of the Public Defender, a state government agency, which solely serves indigent citizens of Maryland. As a result, my request for the above-listed public records is in the public interest.  I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amelia McDonell-Parry
Maryland Office of the Public Defender
Special Litigation Unit
Amelia.McDonell-Parry@maryland.gov

title: Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury Waiver Program Records (Office Of Policy And Management)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury Waiver Program Records (Office Of Policy And Management)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Officers
Subject: Comprehensive FOIA Request for Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury Waiver Program Records

Dear Freedom of Information Officers,

I am writing to formally request access to all records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) (5 U.S.C. § 552) and relevant Connecticut state laws, specifically related to the Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program. This information is critical to my participation in the oversight and administration of this program.

In accordance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. § 794) and the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.), I am requesting accommodations due to my condition. I respectfully request that all records be provided electronically via email, as opposed to portals or complex delivery methods, to ensure full and equal access to the information.

Scope of Request:
Legislative Records:

All bills, amendments, resolutions, legislative proposals, and legislative history related to the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Voting records of all state and federal legislators on any legislation affecting the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Minutes, transcripts, and audio/video recordings of meetings, hearings, or discussions where the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program was a topic.
Public Records:

Comprehensive reports, studies, assessments, and evaluations on the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Budget allocations, financial statements, expenditure reports, and audit results related to the program, pursuant to Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66 and related sections).
All contracts, agreements, memoranda of understanding, and intergovernmental agreements involving the administration or management of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Correspondence:

All emails, letters, and other forms of communication, including internal and external, regarding the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Internal memoranda, briefing documents, policy directives, and decision-making correspondence related to the oversight and implementation of the program.
Personnel Records:

Non-confidential employment records, including job descriptions, resumes, and performance evaluations, of individuals involved in the administration and oversight of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program. This request is consistent with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a), which protects confidential personal data.
Organizational charts detailing the structure and personnel responsible for managing the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program within relevant state and federal agencies.
Program Information:

All guidelines, protocols, procedural documents, and compliance reviews governing the operation of the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, as mandated by Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) for home and community-based services waiver programs.
Implementation plans, performance metrics, outcome reports, and evaluation summaries regarding the effectiveness of the program.
Comprehensive data sets related to enrollment, utilization, demographic information, and outcomes of beneficiaries participating in the Medicaid ABI Waiver Program.
Special Requests:
Expedited Processing: Pursuant to Executive Order 13392, which mandates the improvement of agency disclosure processes, and the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request expedited processing of this FOIA request due to the public interest and personal impact of the information.

Electronic Records: In compliance with my rights under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and the ADA, I request that all records be provided in electronic format and sent directly to my email address. This will ensure that I can access the information without unnecessary barriers or delays.

Fee Waiver Request:
I request a waiver of all fees associated with this FOIA request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). This request is made in the public interest and not for commercial use. The disclosure of the requested information will significantly contribute to public understanding of government operations, particularly concerning the Connecticut Medicaid ABI Waiver Program, which impacts a vulnerable population. Additionally, due to my condition, as covered by Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act, a fee waiver will ensure equitable access to this important information.

Relevant Laws:
This FOIA request, and the accommodations I am requesting, are governed by the following laws and regulations:

Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) – Governing the right to request access to federal records.
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.) – Ensuring equal access for individuals with disabilities, including in communication.
Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. § 794) – Prohibiting discrimination based on disability in programs receiving federal funding.
Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a) – Protecting personal privacy in records maintained by federal agencies.
Medicaid Statute (Title XIX of the Social Security Act) (42 U.S.C. § 1396 et seq.) – Governing Medicaid programs, including waivers like the ABI Waiver.
Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (C.G.S. §§ 1-200 to 1-242) – Governing the right to request access to state records.
Connecticut Budget Transparency Laws (C.G.S. § 4-66) – Requiring public disclosure of state budget allocations and financial reports.
CMS Regulations (42 CFR § 440.180) – Governing the administration of home and community-based services waiver programs, including the ABI Waiver.
Executive Order 13392 ("Improving Agency Disclosure of Information") – Mandating federal agencies to improve FOIA processing.
Non-Waiver of Rights:
This request does not waive any rights I may have under FOIA, the ADA, the Rehabilitation Act, or any other applicable law, and I reserve all rights regarding this matter.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this request and for accommodating my needs.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources

Departments of Submission:
State of Connecticut Agencies:
Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS)
Email: foia.dss@ct.gov
Department: Department of Social Services

Connecticut Office of the Attorney General
Email: attorney.general@ct.gov
Department: Office of the Attorney General

Connecticut General Assembly (CGA)
Email: foia@cga.ct.gov
Department: Connecticut General Assembly

Connecticut Office of Policy and Management (OPM)
Email: opm.foia@ct.gov
Department: Office of Policy and Management

Connecticut Department of Public Health (DPH)
Email: dph.foi@ct.gov
Department: Department of Public Health

Federal Agencies:
U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
Email: HHS_FOIA@hhs.gov
Department: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services

Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS)
Email: FOIA_Request@cms.hhs.gov
Department: Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services

U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ)
Email: foia.requests@usdoj.gov
Department: U.S. Department of Justice

U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD)
Email: foiarequests@hud.gov
Department: U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development

U.S. Department of Labor (DOL)
Email: foiarequests@dol.gov
Department: U.S. Department of Labor

Federal Trade Commission (FTC)
Email: FOIA@ftc.gov
Department: Federal Trade Commission

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS
